channel.title: Posts on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Table41NYC

item.title: Churrascaria Plataforma
item.description: I like this place more than Fogo De Chao. Granted, I have not been to the NY location as of this writing. I’ve been to the LA location twice. The seasoning at this location to me was better. The salad bar was a let down comparably though. It’s small, and they have sushi there which I thought was odd. I still think M-Grill is the best as far as seasoning and char.

item.title: Nu Noodle
item.description: This place’s beef noodles was just OK. I’ve had better. The portion size is just ok. I also got a side of bean curd, and it was a little on the salty side.

item.title: Felix
item.description: This place is CASH ONLY as well. Food was pretty good, and it seems like a nice date spot.

item.title: Mr White
item.description: Fried chicken was pretty mediocre. It was dry, and the rub wasn’t good. It was overcooked, salty, and not as good as say… Popeyes.

item.title: Ipanema
item.description: The food was surprisingly good, and it’s not pricey at all. They give you free sides of rice and beans, so no worries about ordering that.

item.title: Chirp
item.description: The lomo saltado was ok. The sauces cost 60 cents extra.

item.title: Topaz Noodle Bar
item.description: This place was really good for Thai food. Would love to come back again for their Tom Yum noodle soup and their soft shell crab special. Price was not expensive at all either.

item.title: Lady M Cake Boutique
item.description: This was in a small mall, and it was pretty good. We got the eclairs and apple flan.

item.title: Taureau
item.description: This place is CASH ONLY. The chocolate fondu was good, but the cheese that we got was just ok. The meat quality was pretty good with the wine broth.

item.title: Kung Fu Little Steamed Buns
item.description: Good XLB. Was flavorful, BUT the price is pretty expensive for what you get. The dessert XLB filled with nutella/banana was gimmicky but tasted good.

item.title: Di an Di
item.description: The pho was ok, and so was the dried vermicelli. It’s a bit expensive for what you get, but also not bad. I probably would still prefer to go to other Vietnamese places, though good Vietnamese places are hard to find in Manhattan. The decor is nice, but food wise - if anyone likes this place, I don’t trust their palette.

item.title: Ninja
item.description: Food was bland, but the steak was surprisingly good for a touristy spot. There are a lot of scares from the ninja waiters. The sushi itself was also pretty bland and mediocre.

item.title: Holy Ground
item.description: This place was surprisingly good. The pork belly was really tasty with the fried skin and chicharron on top. The beef rib is a must get. Pork ribs are a pass. The ambience is similar to the noir feel.

item.title: Baked by Melissa
item.description: These are super tiny one bite mini cupcakes. Pretty good though the flavor profiles aren’t that different from each other.

item.title: Upland
item.description: Got eggs in hell, and it was a nice alternative to shakshookas. Somewhat spicy. The price wasn’t too expensive.

item.title: Shanghai You Garden
item.description: Known for their XLBs, it was pretty darn tasty. They also have stinky tofu too and it’s all pretty cheap.

item.title: Yoon Haeundae Galbi
item.description: The food was actually surprisingly good. I would come back here again for Korean. The galbi was pretty tasty and the price wasn’t too expensive I think. The meat quality is good.

item.title: Pastrami Plaza
item.description: Pastrami was ok. It was moist yet tips were dry. Food was cheap though, so might be good for lazy dinners. They have other things.

item.title: Chimu Bistro
item.description: The ceviche was good, but the lomo saltado was surprisingly pretty good. Beef slices were tender.

item.title: Tamashii Ramen
item.description: Decent ramen noodles. Soup was a little salty. The egg was disappointing.

item.title: Dokodemo
item.description: Decent Japanese snack place with okonomiyaki and octopus balls. But that’s about it.

item.title: Adrienne's Pizza Bar
item.description: Was ok. Nothing too memorable. Got the pizza with proscuitto on top. I think they should’ve cut it into smaller pieces.

item.title: Bonchon
item.description: Pretty bad and expensive. 10 pieces of bites fro $14, and it doesn’t even come with a drink.

item.title: Berimbau Do Brasil
item.description: The feijoada was pretty good. The picanha was interesting in that it was super soft. Not quite what I was expecting.

item.title: Brooklyn Banh Mi
item.description: Best banh mi I’ve had so far in New York. Cheap too. But this place is CLOSED.
